attributes.action: Better Contracts For NHS Trained Dentists
attributes.additional_details:
Have a long debate and work out a good plan with NHS England and give us all the good dentistry we all deserve, instead of the private dentists making loads of profits.  In Plymouth and South West of England majority of Dental Practices have gone private, leaving a multitude of people without a dentist.  Our children will grow up with bad or no teeth which could lead to oral cancer. I recently saw a local private dentist advertising for an associate dentist offering a salary of £100,000.
Please do something for the working class people  and their children, of our cities.
attributes.background: To negotiate better contracts with NHS Dentists in order for adults and children to have reasonable dental care.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign 'Increase funding to ensure all adults and children have access to a dentist': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/625518
